titleStmt.title: A lamentable ditty made on the death of Robert Deverux, Earl of Essex, who was beheaded in the Tower of London, on Ash-wednesday, 1603. The tune is Walladay
Lamentable dittie composed upon the death of Robert Lord Devereux late Earle of Essex.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for A.M.W.O. and T. Thackeray at the Angle in Duck lane,

notesStmt.note: A second song, with caption: "A lamentable ballad on the Earl of Essex .." (Wing (2nd ed.) L266) is printed on the left side of sheet.
Identified as Wing L266 on UMI microfilm set "Early English books, 1641-1700" reel 2123.
Reproduction of the original in the Glasgow University Library.
